Despite his limited commercial success, Van Gogh was supported by his brother Theo, an art dealer, who sold his paintings and corresponded with him frequently.

He initially worked as an art dealer but soon found his calling in painting, which he pursued with relentless passion. Van Gogh's tragic life culminated in a fatal event. On July 27, 1890, he was admitted to the Saint-Rémy asylum in France. Vincent van Gogh passed away on July 29, 1890, leaving behind a rich artistic legacy that continues to inspire artists and art lovers worldwide.
